questions.question: A time-boxed period in Scrum during which work is completed.
questions.explanation: A Sprint is a fixed time period in Scrum, typically 2-4 weeks, during which specific work must be completed.

questions.question: The Scrum role responsible for maximizing product value and managing the backlog.
questions.explanation: The Product Owner defines product features, prioritizes the backlog, and ensures the team delivers maximum value.

questions.question: The Scrum role that facilitates the process and removes impediments.
questions.explanation: The Scrum Master ensures the team follows Scrum practices, facilitates meetings, and removes blockers.

questions.question: A brief daily meeting where team members synchronize their work.
questions.explanation: The Daily Standup is a 15-minute meeting where team members share progress, plans, and impediments.

questions.question: A prioritized list of features and requirements for the product.
questions.explanation: The Product Backlog contains all desired work on the product, ordered by priority and business value.

questions.question: A meeting at the end of a Sprint to reflect and identify improvements.
questions.explanation: The Sprint Retrospective is where the team discusses what went well, what didn't, and how to improve.

questions.question: A visual workflow management method that limits work in progress.
questions.explanation: Kanban uses visual boards to manage workflow and explicitly limits work in progress to improve flow.

questions.question: An Agile practice where two developers work together at one workstation.
questions.explanation: Pair programming has two programmers collaborate on the same code, improving quality and knowledge sharing.

questions.question: A brief description of a feature from the user's perspective.
questions.explanation: A user story captures a feature requirement in simple language focusing on user value and benefit.

questions.question: The meeting where the team demonstrates completed work to stakeholders.
questions.explanation: The Sprint Review showcases completed work to stakeholders and gathers feedback for future iterations.
